metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2376 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3 is affected. Safari before 10.1 is affected. The issue involves the "Safari" component. It allows remote attackers to spoof the address bar by leveraging text input during the loading of a page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.1-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.1-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.1-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.1-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.16.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.1-1').
